pr_title: Endpoint to pause and resume exporting

timeline.message: feat(broker): expose pause exporting via admin api

timeline.bodyText: Maybe we can move this out to a method like shouldExport. It gets a bit out of hand
timeline.author: Zelldon

timeline.bodyText: We probably also want to have one endpoint to pause everything right?
timeline.author: Zelldon

replies.bodyText: Do we want that? prepareUpgrade does pause all.
replies.author: deepthidevaki

replies.bodyText: Yeah might be enough thanks
replies.author: Zelldon

timeline.bodyText: So we have a optional in a future? sounds like duplicated complexity 🤔
timeline.author: Zelldon

replies.bodyText: It's optional because followers doesn't have streamProcessor.
replies.author: deepthidevaki

replies.bodyText: but then it can be just null not ? 😅 Idk just have the feeling it is unnecessary
replies.author: Zelldon
deepthidevaki

replies.bodyText: Yeah to use methods like .orElse or ifPresentThen etc but just to check whether is present I see no point in creating two separate objects for it. Not a fan of it.
replies.author: Zelldon

replies.bodyText: You can keep it but it just wanted to mention this.
replies.author: Zelldon

timeline.bodyText: Normally it is wise to use enums for that. This would be more future proven. What are you doing if we add a new case like, stopped, canceled, interrupted.
timeline.author: Zelldon

replies.bodyText: Would also be consistent with the processing phase, were we already have that.
replies.author: Zelldon

timeline.author: Zelldon

timeline.bodyText: I could swear that we had this functionality before somewhere :D
timeline.author: Zelldon

replies.bodyText: But why we need that actually?
replies.author: Zelldon

replies.bodyText: There is an actor.runOnCompletion(Collection<ActorFuture> futures);
replies.author: Zelldon

replies.bodyText: I don't know why when I tried to use actor.runOnCompletion(Collection<ActorFuture> futures) it did not work. It complained about types. But now I could make it work. I have now changed it to use actor futures. But honestly I don't like ActorFuture 😉
replies.author: deepthidevaki

replies.bodyText:
But honestly I don't like ActorFuture wink

This is a different topic 😆
replies.author: Zelldon

timeline.bodyText: This is exact duplicates. Could we make it parameterized to reuse it?
timeline.author: Zelldon

timeline.bodyText:
Not sure whether I get this.
We first pause the exporting (which actually internally just persist the file), then we check whether there is a exporter and whether we should not export (which should always be the case i guess?!).
Maybe it makes sense to rename the method so it is more clear what actually happens. We persist the pausing state and remove the check. I see no value in it?
timeline.author: Zelldon

replies.bodyText: The check is added as a safeguard incase persisting of the state was not successful. Do you think that is unnecessary?
replies.author: deepthidevaki

replies.bodyText: So you actually want to check whether the persisting succeeded so maybe you check the return value of the method which is called persistPauseState
replies.author: Zelldon

replies.bodyText: Then it is I think more clear. Do you agree?
replies.author: Zelldon

timeline.bodyText: Is this maybe problematic? That we might have an race condition where we can export maybe one record because we are so fast?
timeline.author: Zelldon

replies.bodyText: Might make sense to give the state as parameter of the startAsync?
replies.author: Zelldon

replies.bodyText: That's right. I pass it as an argument to the constructor now. This will be a problem in StreamProcessor as well, because it also follows the same pattern.
replies.author: deepthidevaki

replies.bodyText: Do you want to create a follow up issue for that? Or do you want to do it in this pr?
replies.author: Zelldon

replies.bodyText: I will create a follow up issue.
replies.author: deepthidevaki

timeline.author: Zelldon

timeline.bodyText: what is the matter of this? We never assert whether we have seen this record?
timeline.author: Zelldon

replies.bodyText: Would be nice to have such a verification
replies.author: Zelldon

timeline.bodyText: These cast are not necessary or?
timeline.author: Zelldon

replies.bodyText: Yes. They are necessary.
replies.author: deepthidevaki

replies.bodyText: why is that ? 🤔
replies.author: Zelldon

replies.bodyText: ah I see because Optional<Exporter> and Optional<StreamProcessor>
replies.author: Zelldon

replies.bodyText:
Without it I get following error
Required type:
Collection
<ActorFuture<T>>
Provided:
List
<ActorFuture<? extends Optional<? extends Actor>>>
reason: Incompatible equality constraint: Optional<ExporterDirector> and Optional<StreamProcessor>
replies.author: deepthidevaki
